Pemerintah Harus Lindungi Industri Telekomunikasi Lokal
07 Nov 2019, 07:53 by Ai Rika Rachmawati
BANDUNG, (PR).- Pemerintah harus melindungi industri telekomunikasi lokal dari gempuran asing, salah satunya melalui aturan Tingkat Kandungan Dalam Negeri (TKDN). Perlindungan tersebut diperlukan agar produk telekomunikasi lokal menjadi tuan tumah di negeri sendiri.
Demikian diungkapkan Ketua Umum Asosiasi Perusahaan Nasional Telekomunikasi (Apnatel), Triana Mulyatsa, melalui siaran pers yang diterima "PR", Kamis, 7 November 2019. Rabu kemarin Apnatel baru saja menggelar Rapat Kerja Nasional (Rakernas) dan Seminar di Jakarta.
"Peran pemerintah sangat diperlukan untuk mendukung tumbuh kembang industri telekomunikasi nasional," ujar Triana.
Apnatel sendiri, menurut dia, siap menjadi mitra pemerintah untuk membantu melindungi industri telekomunikasi lokal. Bukan hanya dari serbuan produk asing, tapi juga pabrik asing yang hadir di Indonesia.
"Hal yang juga tak kalah pentingnya adalah jangan sampai ada anggapan di tengah masyarakat bahwa produk lokal lebih mahal daripada produk luar," tuturnya.
Untuk itu, menurut dia, keberpihakan pemerintah terhadap pelaku usaha lokal dalam bentuk subsidi sangat diperlukan. Dengan demikian, harga jual produk lokal bisa ditekan menjadi lebih murah.
"Dari sisi kualitas produk lokal sudah bisa bersaing dengan produk asing," tuturnya.
Bukan hanya gempuran asing, menurut dia, saat ini Apnatel juga dihadapkan pada persoalan keberadaan organisasi lain yang bisa menerbitkan sertifikasi profesi telekomunikasi. Padahal, organisasi tersebut tidak bergerak di bidang telekomunikasi
"Ini yang menjadi PR besar kami untuk mentertibkan organisasi tersebut," ujar Triana.
Ketua Apnatel Jabar yang juga Presiden Direktur (Presdir) dan Chief Executive Officer (CEO) PT Borsya Cipta Communica (BCC), Boris Syaifullah, juga mengaku berharap agar pemerintah lebih memperhatikan pelaku industri telekomunikasi lokal. Apalagi, seperti diketahui, sektor telekomunikasi merupakan salah satu penopang utama laju pertumbuhan ekonomi nasional.
"Pada kesempatan ini kami juga meminta agar Apnatel Pusat lebih memperhatikan DPD yang berisikan para profesional. Kami di Jabar sendiri serius ingin membesarkan organisasi ini," ujarnya. BCC merupakan salah satu sponsor dalam kegiatan Rakernas tersebut.
Direktur Jenderal (Dirjen) Sumber Daya Â Perangkat Pos dan Informatika Kementerian Informasi dan Komunikasi (Kemkominfo), Ismail, mengatakan, pemerintah, siap melindungi industri telekomunikasi lokal. Kemkominfo, menurut dia, siap membantu dan mendukung pengusaha sektor telekomunikasi lokal untuk mengembangkan usahanya.
"Kami siap menjembati kebutuhan pengusaha, baik terkait infrastruktur maupun perizinan di daerah," ujarnya.
Di sisi lain, ia juga meminta agar pelaku usaha telekomunikasi lokal harus jeli melihat pasar di Indonesia. Ia mengatakan, jangan sampai perusahaan yang bergerak di bidang telekomunikasi ini mati di tengah jalan.***

The Government Must Protect the Local Telecommunications Industry
Nov 7, 2019, 07:53 by Ai Rika Rachmawati
BANDUNG, (PR) .- The government must protect the local telecommunications industry from foreign strikes, one of which through the rules of the Domestic Content (TKDN). Such protection is needed so that local telecommunications products become hosts in their own country.
This was stated by the General Chairperson of the National Telecommunications Company Association (Apnatel), Triana Mulyatsa, through a press release received by "PR", Thursday, November 7, 2019. Last Wednesday Apnatel had just held a National Working Meeting (Rakernas) and Seminar in Jakarta.
"The role of the government is needed to support the growth and development of the national telecommunications industry," Triana said.
Apnatel himself, according to him, is ready to become a government partner to help protect the local telecommunications industry. Not only from the invasion of foreign products, but also foreign factories that are present in Indonesia.
"What is also important is that there must not be an assumption in the community that local products are more expensive than foreign products," he said.
For this reason, according to him, the government's support for local businesses in the form of subsidies is very much needed. Thus, the selling price of local products can be reduced to be cheaper.
"In terms of quality local products can compete with foreign products," he said.
Not only the onslaught of foreigners, according to him, at this time Apnatel was also faced with the problem of the existence of other organizations that could issue telecommunications profession certification. In fact, the organization is not engaged in telecommunications
"This is our big PR to regulate the organization," Triana said.
West Java Apnatel Chairman who is also the President Director (President) and Chief Executive Officer (CEO) of PT Borsya Cipta Communica (BCC), Boris Syaifullah, also claimed to hope that the government would pay more attention to local telecommunications industry players. Moreover, as is well known, the telecommunications sector is one of the main pillars of national economic growth.
"On this occasion we also ask that Apnatel Pusat pay more attention to the DPD which contains professionals. We in West Java are serious about wanting to grow this organization," he said. BCC is one of the sponsors of the Rakernas activities.
The Director General (Dirjen) of Post and Information Technology Resources at the Ministry of Information and Communication (Kemkominfo), Ismail, said the government was ready to protect the local telecommunications industry. Kemkominfo, according to him, is ready to help and support local telecommunications sector entrepreneurs to develop their businesses.
"We are ready to meet the needs of entrepreneurs, both related to infrastructure and licensing in the regions," he said.
On the other hand, he also requested that local telecommunications businesses must be keen to see the market in Indonesia. He said, do not let this company engaged in telecommunications die in the middle of the road. ***
